title: Bear moves to sell stake as it ponders overseas expansion
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Sat, Aug 29, 2015, 20:33 BST - UK Markets closed Bear moves to sell stake as it ponders overseas expansion By Ashley Armstrong | Telegraph – 2 minutes 15 seconds ago 14.98 -0.06 
The founders of the fruit snack business have hired advisers at McQueen to explore selling a stake 
Bear, the fruits snack business founded by a husband and wife team, is planning on selling a multi-million-pound stake in the company to help fund an international expansion. 
Former fitness instructor Hayley Gait-Golding and her husband Andrew have hired advisers at consumer corporate finance specialist McQueen to explore options. The London-based business, which is on track to generate sales of around £23 m this year, is likely to be valued at around £50 m. 
The company, which sells fruit snacks called YoYos and Bear Nibbles and has recently branched into cereals, attracted investment in 2009 from Giles Brook, the former commercial director of smoothy maker Innocent Drinks . 
Bear, known for its distinctive and colourful packaging, recently became the biggest seller of children’s fruit snacks in the UK. 
Its products are sold in 2,000 outlets across the UK, including J Sainsbury (Other OTC: JSAIY - news ) and other major supermarkets (Other OTC: UBGXF - news ) .
